short_summary: Notice of Intent to Acquire Tender er Stamp
full_summary:
## Expression of Interest for Land Acquisition in Cheticamp, NS
### [Reference Number: CB-829-88468090]

The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) invites expressions of interest to acquire a 1.5 to 6 acre property (approximately 0.61 to 1.6 hectares) in the town of Cheticamp, Nova Scotia.

### Property Requirements

The property must meet the following criteria:

* Size: 1.5 to 6 acres (approximately 0.61 to 1.6 hectares)
* Location: situated between Grand Etang and the border of the Cape Breton Highlands National Park on the Cheticamp side
* Road Frontage: have arterial road frontage (direct road access or confirmation of ability to obtain access)
* Zoning: preference for properties zoned commercial, institutional, or industrial
* Shape: preferably rectangular in shape
* Proximity to amenities: be in close proximity to amenities such as service stations, financial institutions, and restaurants

### Required Information from Property Owner

The property owner or their agent must provide the following information:

* A map showing the location of the property
* Site plan
* Current zoning description
* Details of services and utilities
* Statement regarding the nature of the respondent's rights in the land
* Completed Phase I Site Assessment (if available)
* Completed Property Transfer Assessment Questionnaire

### Submission Requirements

Interested parties must submit their expression of interest by July 3, 2024, to the following address:

By email: [Glenda.Mercer@rcmp-grc.gc.ca](mailto:Glenda.Mercer@rcmp-grc.gc.ca)

Or by mail:

Glenda Mercer
Assets and Procurement
Royal Canadian Mounted Police
80 Garland Avenue, Mailstop H-060
Dartmouth, NS B3B 0J8

### Contact Information

For further information, please contact:

Glenda Mercer
Assets and Procurement
Royal Canadian Mounted Police
(902) 720-5372

### Note

The RCMP reserves the right to request additional information from interested parties. Agents submitting a response to this expression of interest must provide a letter from the property owner authorizing them to do so.
